A quadratic residue modulo n is an integer that is congruent to a perfect square modulo n. To find all quadratic residues modulo 7, we will calculate the squares of the integers from 0 to 6 (since 7 is the modulus) and then reduce them modulo 7.

0² ≡ 0 (mod 7)
1² ≡ 1 (mod 7)
2² ≡ 4 (mod 7)
3² ≡ 9 ≡ 2 (mod 7)
4² ≡ 16 ≡ 2 (mod 7)
5² ≡ 25 ≡ 4 (mod 7)
6² ≡ 36 ≡ 1 (mod 7)

The quadratic residues modulo 7 are the unique results of these congruences: {0, 1, 2, 4}.
